title: Top Ecommerce Companies in the USA | Similarweb
description: Find the best B2B leads with our latest lists of the top ecommerce companies in the US, plus the fastest-growing ecommerce companies. Download now.
content: HomeBlogSalesSelling to EcommerceTop Ecommerce Companies in the USA: 100 Brands to Watch Right Now Sales Intelligence Top Ecommerce Companies in the USA: 100 Brands to Watch Right Now Try our platform for free by Keren Feldsher , Senior Content Marketing Manager 13 Min. July 25, 2024 X Facebook Linkedin Copy link Free Website Traffic Checker Discover your competitors' strengths and leverage them to achieve your own success Analyze Traffic Selling to ecommerce companies? Then you‚Äôll want to keep a close eye on the top performers in the space. That‚Äôs why we create ‚Äî and regularly update ‚Äî our rankings of the top ecommerce companies in the US, including the top 50 and the 50 fastest-growing. We‚Äôve got lists for the UK‚Äôs top ecommerce companies and the top ecommerce companies in the world, too (after all, you‚Äôve got to keep that digital sales strategy sharp to win big). So, which ecommerce brands are soaring ahead in terms of website traffic? And which ones are on the rise? First up, we‚Äôve got some key stats about both the top ecommerce companies and the fastest-growing ‚Äî then, in just a few scrolls down, you‚Äôll find the United States‚Äô top 50 ecommerce companies, followed by the top 50 fastest-growing ecommerce brands. Your unfair sales advantage Grab your prospects' attention with insights from Similarweb Sales Intelligence Book a live demo Key stats about the top ecommerce brands in the US Through our traffic data, we saw the following themes in June 2024: üèûÔ∏è It‚Äôs all about the outdoors üîë Leveraging timely keywords is key üí™ Skin care is top of mind üè° Being a household name pays off Top ecommerce companies in the United States Here‚Äôs a little teaser of what you‚Äôll find in the full downloadable list of the top 50 ecommerce companies in the United States: Rank Domain Monthly Visits HQ country 1 amazon.com 1,904,060,330 United States 2 ebay.com 547,401,112 United States 3 walmart.com 389,089,607 Canada 4 etsy.com 254,104,199 United States 5 homedepot.com 186,313,707 United States 6 t-mobile.com 196,896,735 United States 7 att.com 173,574,931 United States 8 target.com 158,978,598 United States 9 apple.com 146,630,703 United States 10 lowes.com 116,024,248 United States 11 temu.com 97,280,637 United States 12 wayfair.com 103,631,302 United States 13 macys.com 93,223,603 United States 14 costco.com 89,496,195 United States 15 gap.com 74,312,978 United States The criteria used to create this top 50 list of US ecommerce companies (so you can do it too with Similarweb Sales Intelligence) were: Geography: United States Website Type: Ecommerce Website Technologies: Only sites with Ecommerce technologies Ranked by monthly desktop & mobile visits in June 2024 Download the full list here: A deeper dive at the top 5 ecommerce companies in the US The top 15 sneak peek might have curbed curiosity temporarily, but if you‚Äôre anything like us, we want to know ‚Äúwhy‚Äù these companies are on top. Using Similarweb Sales Intelligence tells us precisely that. Let‚Äôs see it in action with a deep dive into the top 5 ecommerce companies in the US in June 2024: 1. Amazon.com With close to 24 million ecommerce businesses to shop at, the consistent top choice of consumers is no surprise; it‚Äôs Amazon. What might be surprising is that amazon.com‚Äôs year-over-year (YoY) is down 2.63%, and month-over-month (MoM) visits are down 0.74%. New ecommerce competitors emerge on the scene every day, but 1.743B total visits in June point to Amazon‚Äôs strong stay power. Amazon.com‚Äôs largest traffic source was direct, with 1B visits, followed by organic search, with 417.1M visits. Although amazon.com is seeing a dip in website visits, it‚Äôs also seeing positive changes to engagement metrics ‚Äî specifically, Bounce Rates have improved by 0.28% on desktop. As mentioned, Direct and Organic Search led the charge in driving traffic to Amazon. So, what was the world looking for that led them to the site? Short answer: everything and anything. Slightly longer answer: these are the 15 most popular organic non-branded keywords for June‚Ä¶ prime video prime gaming prime aws kindle cloud reader kindle the boys send to kindle prime video login freevee twitch prime seller central amazonprime kdp aws login Amazon Prime Video and Amazon Kindle-related search terms made up 60% of the top 15. Also in the top 15 is an Amazon original (and exclusive) series, The Boys. We also see Seller Central (the portal sellers can enter to get into their Amazon accounts) made it to the top 15, and Freevee (an Amazon TV channel). 5 out of 15 top organic, non-branded keywords for amazon.com saw positive MoM change ‚Äî The Boys specifically saw an impressive 754.73% MoM increase. 2. Ebay.com eBay is one of the first ecomemerce companies to create and market an online business connecting buyers and sellers of goods and services. And eBay has also become another household name. Like its predecessor, eBay.com‚Äôs June traffic decreased from 546M to 539M total visits YoY (1.34%). Even though ebay.com‚Äôs MoM total visits were down -2.06%, there‚Äôs been an uptick in June for Pages Per Visit on desktop (0.37%) and mobile web (0.19%). Jumping over to the channels that drove the most traffic, direct visits brought in the most (258.8M), followed by organic search (205M), and then paid search (28.4M). These three channels contributed 48.05%, 38.05%, and 5.27%, respectively, to the total traffic. What were people really searching for on eBay? The short answer: the unexpected. Curious shoppers turned to eBay with some truly unique queries. To give you a glimpse into the minds of eBay users, here are the platform‚Äôs 15 most popular non-branded organic search terms from June. ebaymotors terapeak new listed utica club steins for sale alley cats strike vhs ols1-1c www.ebaymotors.com all utica club steins for sale part coupons myebay christine mcvie google model senetaslo mickey mouse clubhouse deluxe playset Interstingly, the keywords that had the highest MoM change in searches were myebay with 81.86%, ols1-1c with 80.04%, and Mickey Mouse Clubhouse Deluxe Playset with 74.40%. 3. Walmart.com The third spot goes to walmart.com, which had 373.9M visits in June, a decrease of 0.27 MoM. Let‚Äôs see what‚Äôs happening with Walmart‚Äôs Traffic & Engagement metrics. Walmart has a mix of ups and downs. One of the positive metrics walmart.com experienced was the visit duration. In June, both desktop and mobile saw increases ‚Äî 1.18% and 0.64%. There was also a nice uptick in pages per visit, again on both desktop (2.14%) and mobile web (0.64%). The largest traffic source for walmart.com was organic search, with 149.3M visits, followed by direct search, with 137.5M visits. With such high organic search traffic, let‚Äôs see what keywords users were searching for. Calling all bargain hunters? We peeked behind the curtain at Walmart‚Äôs search data for June and it seems that US consumers came to walmart.com with a mission (aka high-intent searches), as evidenced by these top 15 non-branded organic keywords. Get ready for some serious shopping inspiration (and maybe a few surprises): onewalmart spark driver jobs near me sam‚Äôs club careers onn 4k pro walmartone sams club jobs wmlink/2step ps5 poster printing spark walgreens sams careers sams club careers portable air conditioner The biggest theme emerging from the top organic non-branded keyword is a search for jobs or sam‚Äôs clubs careers. In these top 15 keywords, ‚Äòjobs near me‚Äô saw the largest MoM change, with an impressive spike of 165.74%. 4. Etsy.com Want to find more unique products and support small businesses? Join the millions of consumers shopping at etsy.com. June brought in 230.6M monthly visits to this top retailer, which is down 2.85% MoM and 88.47% YoY. Regarding Etsy‚Äôs Pages Per Visit metric, we‚Äôre seeing a slight increase on desktop of 0.16% but a decrease on mobile of 2.86% MoM. The largest traffic source for etsy.com in June was direct, with 88.5M, then organic search, with 85M, followed by paid search at 27.9M. Social media, though, also played a significant part with 21.5M visits. What were US consumers looking for that led them to etsy.com? Here are the top 15 non-branded organic keywords for June‚Ä¶ fantasyart fantasy art sketch new listed utica steins for sale elegua prayer nipple slips journey bailie google search engine world map imprinted supplies christmas believe vector june 2024 calendar anniversary gifts all utica club steins for sale handcrafted handy dandy notebook tocaluna Two themes emerging from the top organic, non-branded keywords are searches for fantasy art and jewelry. In this set of Ety‚Äôs top 15 keywords, ‚Äúanniversary gifts‚Äù saw the largest MoM change with a 303.96% increase. 5. Homedepot.com The last spot in our top five is Home Depot, where shoppers can get supplies for their handiwork projects. In June, homedepot.com had 199.3M total visits, a MoM decrease of 5.05% and a YoY decrease of 6.04%. The largest traffic channel from Home Depot was organic search, with 95.9M visits, followed by direct search, at 61.7M, and then paid search, at 23.4M visits. Social media brought in 9.8M visits. Feeling the heat? You‚Äôre not alone. This June, a surge in air conditioner searches on HomeDepot.com shows what ‚Äúdoers‚Äù were after. But that‚Äôs just the tip of the iceberg. Dive into the top 15 non-branded organic keywords to see what other projects had US DIYers reaching for their tool belts: portable air conditioner air conditioner dehumidifier portable ac pressure washer moving boxes model window ac unit lawn mower mini split ac torque wrench blinds patio furniture refrigerator ryobi days In this set of Home Depot‚Äôs top 15 keywords, ‚Äúportable air conditioner‚Äù saw the most considerable MoM change, with a +119.03% increase. People like to be on the move with their air conditioners! Top fastest-growing ecommerce companies list in the US Ready to meet our April 2024 winners? Here‚Äôs a quick intro to the 15 fastest-growing US ecommerce companies: Rank Domain MoM Change Monthly Visits HQ country 1 grasscity.com 226.82% 1,049,209 Netherlands 2 maelyscosmetics.com 164.49% 1,471,596 United States 3 theanimalrescuesite.com 110.84% 3,901,554 United States 4 bismanonline.com 107.80% 1,019,960 United States 5 rticoutdoors.com 82.33% 2,040,834 United States 6 rhoback.com 70.88% 1,035,258 United States 7 bluettipower.com 68.24% 1,203,672 United States 8 fentybeauty.com 62.57% 1,855,133 United States 9 rockbottomgolf.com 45.50% 1,375,289 United States 10 gymshark.com 45.45% 4,180,268 United Kingdom 11 thewoobles.com 44.13% 1,863,750 United States 12 pgatoursuperstore.com 44.00% 2,818,825 United States 13 goodr.com 43.91% 1,620,866 United States 14 tommybahama.com 40.83% 3,022,352 United States 15 saks.com 39.99% 7,569,812 United States The criteria we used to create this list (so you can do it too, with Similarweb Sales Intelligence): Geography: United States Website Type: Ecommerce Website Technologies: Only sites with Ecommerce technologies Monthly Visits: Over 1 million Ranked by monthly visits increase, March 2024 vs April 2024 Download the full list here: A deeper dive into the top 5 fastest-growing ecommerce companies in the United States Here‚Äôs what we found out about these winners using Similarweb Sales Intelligence: 1. Grasscity.com The number one spot for the fastest-growing ecommerce site goes to grasscity.com. In June, Grass City saw a 226.82% MoM increase and 53.02% YoY growth, totaling 1.049M visitors. Moving to the Traffic & Engagement overview, grasscity.com‚Äôs visit duration saw a nice bump in June ‚Äì desktop had a 39.21% increase while mobile web was up by 55.78%. The ecommerce site saw an increase in pages per visit on mobile devices of 5.75% and page views on desktop of 196.27% and mobile of 218.33%. When it comes to channels, the ones that brought in the most visitors are organic search (474.1K), direct (417.9K), referrals (85.4K), and social (39.7K). And out of the 1M visitors, 758.3K, more than 75%, came from mobile! With such high organic search traffic, let‚Äôs take a look at the top 15 organic non-branded keywords users were searching for: grasscity dab rigs bongs grass city black leaf valhalla boxed beaker bong with tree percolator dab rig bong bong shop double tree perc bong ice bong bongs give off marijuana smell? buy weed accesories bong for smoking glass pipe nectar collector 2. Maelyscosmetics.com The June runner-up spot goes to Maelys Cosmetics. The online retailer sells creams, masks, and other beauty skin care products. This month, maelyscosmetics.com saw a MoM growth of 164.49% (1.471M) and a YoY growth of 23.35%. When checking out Maelys Cosmetics‚Äô Traffic & Engagement metrics, we see positive MoM growth on all fronts. Specifically, we see a nice increase in their bounce rate of 21.77% on desktop devices. When it comes to traffic channels, maelyscosmetics.com‚Äôs biggest driver is social media, with 483.1K, followed by paid search, with 446.7K, and then direct, with 340.5 K. This is our first brand with the largest traffic coming in from social media. The top five paid non-branded search terms that drove traffic to Maelys Cosmetics site were: ma√´lys mayles cosmetics tighten stomach skin butt enhancement cream under breast antiperspirant 3. Theanimalrescuesite.com The third place for the fastest-growing ecommerce site in the US goes to theanimalrescuesite.com. The Animal Rescue Site, a leading information and ecommerce site for animal rescue efforts, saw a 110.84% MoM growth in June with 11.35M total visits. Regarding theanimalrescuesite.com‚Äôs bounce rate metric, we see an improvement on desktop (27.31%) and mobile web (14.89%). There are also upward trends for visit duration, pages per visit, and page views. As we move over to the Marketing Channels for The Animal Rescue Site, the channels that brought in the most traffic were: Direct (1.7M) Organic search (1.5M) Referrals (408K) Let‚Äôs also take a look at the SEO strategy theanimalrescuesite.com was working on. Here are the top 15 non-branded keywords driving users to The Animal Rescue Site: flip flops that leave a cat paw print pet home rescue box animal rescue site greater good paw print purse feet paw shoes capri cat leggings cat toilet paper holder women‚Äôs paw shirt designs frog and cat mixed paw print birthstone ring animal rescuer women‚Äôs paw sleeve shirt designs jonny kim palm Ropetek 4. Bismanonline.com Our next spot for the fastest-growing ecommerce site goes to bismanonline.com. In June, the site hit 1.019M total visitors, a 107.8% increase MoM and 11.23% increase YoY. Bisman Online is also growing faster than the industry average by -0.78%. When we examined bismanonline.com‚Äôs traffic and engagement, we found that page views had been trending upward in June. Desktop increased by 25.13%, and mobile increased by 63.41%. There was also a slight increase in the bounce rate on mobile devices (29.87%). Moving onto the channels that drove the most traffic to Bisman Online, we see that organic led the traffic (631.5K), then direct (329.5K), followed by social (41.6K). We also noticed that out of 1M visitors, 852.2K came from mobile devices, regardless of which channel they came from. Hopping over to the organic non-branded keywords, the top 15 keywords that brought people to the site are: bisman cars for sale dickinson classifieds bismannonline 1988 yarcraft tiller craftsman 137.248.100 stephen schnaible pedalcoupe pedal grinding stone bisman onin honda ruckus for sale in nd bisman honda ruckus in north dakota alloway westgo mandan nd classifieds craftsman table saw dado regency conversion value 2000 e250 regency conversion van In this set of Bisman Online‚Äôs 15 keywords, ‚Äúbismanonline‚Äù saw the largest MoM change, with a +143.24% search increase, and the runner-up was a tie between ‚Äòhonda ruckus for sale in nd‚Äô and ‚Äòbisman honda ruckus in north dakota‚Äô with 93.79%. 5. Rtcoutdoors.com The last spot on this list is rtcoutdoors.com. In June, Rtc Outdoors had 2.040M total visitors, an 82.33% MoM increase and a 31.68% YoY increase. Analyzing their Traffic & Engagement, we noticed the visit duration decreased on desktop by 3.74% but increased on mobile by 0.05%. There were similar trends (increases and decreases) for both bounce rate and page views. The bounce rate on desktop improved by 15.75% but declined on mobile by 7.13%. And for page views, desktop decreased by 10.74%, but mobile web improved by 87.92%. On to Rtc Outdoors‚Äôs Marketing Channels. Unlike the other fastest-growing sites, paid search brought in the most traffic (835.6K), followed by direct (699.9K), and then organic search (247.5K). When we checked the organic non-branded keywords rtcoutdoors.com was working with, these were the top 15: rtic cooler tie down kit cooler backpack rtic coupon code father‚Äôs day gifts rtic 65 cooler rtic careers rtic water bottle rtic customer service rtic soft side cooler 16oz lid replacement twist on for rtic 16 oz travel coffee cup tumbler (right handed) rtic hot cold mugd eith handle custom coolers rtic 45 storm rtic coolers website artic cooler Within the top 15 non-branded keywords, ‚Äòrtic customer service‚Äô saw the largest MoM change, with a 155.69% jump. But we also checked the paid search terms for branded and non-branded and found these in the top five: rtic rtic coolers rtic outdoors artic coolers trade artic cooler And in this set of keywords, ‚Äòrtc coolers‚Äô saw the largest MoM change, with an increase of 43.37%. Go beyond the top 50 If you want to pull ecommerce insights like these in seconds ‚Äî and we think you might ‚Äî book a demo to find out just how Similarweb Sales Intelligence can help you uncover your ideal prospects, their tech setups, and their pain points for 2024. Your unfair sales advantage Grab your prospects' attention with insights from Similarweb Sales Intelligence Book a live demo FAQs Which is the biggest ecommerce company in the United States? Amazon.com remains the top ecommerce company in the world, with 1.819B total visits in June 2024. Amazon is followed closely by ebay.com, which has a total of 538.7B visits. How big is the US ecommerce market in traffic? The top five largest markets for ecommerce (4.8B total visits) in order are the United States (19.99%), Japan (9.69%), Russia (7.20%), and Brazil (4.98%). by Keren Feldsher Senior Content Marketing Manager Keren is a content marketing expert with 7+ years of experience. A New Yorker with a B.Sc. in English Literature, she enjoys true crime podcasts and brunch.
